thread.title: América Móvil Returns to Profit in First Quarter

author: Anthony Harrup
title: América Móvil Returns to Profit in First Quarter
text:
MEXICO CITY—Latin America’s biggest telecommunications company, América Móvil SAB, moved back into the black in the first quarter as a favorable regulatory ruling helped lift operating profit in Mexico and a strong peso cut financial costs.
The company controlled by billionaire Carlos Slim reported a net profit of 17.7 billion Mexican pesos ($940 million) in the January-March period, equivalent to 0.27 pesos per share or 29 cents per American depositary receipt.
